comments.body: Maybe an example for both of these.  Is stdout_callback just a True|False to enable or disable it?  Is callback_whitelist just a comma separated string of plugin names?  Do the plugin names end in ".py"?
i put examples commented out in examples/ansible.cfg

Maybe take out the macros portion.

> There are several special placeholder values that be placed in the `ansible_managed` string.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +118,122 @@be directly edited because Ansible may overwrite the contents of the file.

There are several special placeholder values that be placed in the ``ansible_managed`` string to act as macros.  These are not in the default ``ansible_managed`` string because they can cause Ansible to behave as though the
entire template has changed when only the ansible_managed string which has
changed.
